Reviews.Title: “Just loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MerryMegsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in June, we chose the hotel due to the central location and were not disappointed. The hotel sits on a busy street with Tapas Bars literally side by side down the whole street, even the hotel has a Tapas bar and restuarant. This made it super easy to find somewhere to eat as the choice was amazing. Our room was extremely comfortable, the bed is king size and the pillows were really the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel, wished I could have taken them home! The bathroom is nice with a rain head shower and toiletries were topped up daily. Wifi was okay, sometimes it was slow. I was concerned that the room may be noisy as we faced onto the main street, but the shutters and double glazing really cut out most of the noise, but I do admit we got into Spanish life, staying up late, so by the time we did go to bed, things had quietened down. We were in Madrid over a weekend and there was a noticeable difference between how busy the street was on Saturday night to Sunday and Monday. But definitely don't be concerned about noise, it really was not a factor. We found the staff to be friendly and we were always greeted coming in and out of the hotel. We did not have breakfast or eat in the restaurant but we did have some tapas and drinks in the bar which was really nice and good spot for a night cap. I would highly recommend this hotel, the location is superb, comfort levels are excellent and reasonable price for Madrid. If I return to Madrid I'll be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, small hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JTea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this small hotel for the last night of our trip to Spain, but I wish we had been able to stay here for several more days. The rooms are each very unique - my in-laws had a room on the upper floor with sloping ceilings and a window overlooking the quiet street. My husband and I and our two kids had two adjoining rooms that had small balconies. The location is great - a quiet street but near lots of restaurants, etc. There is an excellent fruit market a few doors down. When we arrived, we were served a wine drink (juice for the kids) while we completed the paperwork. The breakfast was not included in our rate, but by paying the day before for the next morning's breakfast, there was a discount. The breakfast didn't look like much at first, but a server will bring coffee, juice, and eggs cooked to order. Excellent croissants. I recommend eating here before heading out for the day. All staff members were very friendly and accommodating, and spoke English pretty well. We loved this hotel and would look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: talblet
Reviews.Content: I really can't speak too highly of this hotel. From the moment we arrived the staff were warm and friendly and anxious to help. The entrance to the hotel and the bar area have a lovely, welcoming feel and plenty of character. It's in a great location right in the heart of La Latina which is a lovely part of the city and one of the main tapas bar areas and it's only 5 mins walk to Plaza Mayor. Our room was fantastic and very thoughtfully designed with a jacuzzi in the centre of the room, a separate bathroom with a walk-in shower, a velvet chaise longue and an enormous king size bed which was extremely comfortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious and very varied and the hotel bar had a great selection of wines and tapas. Look no further than this hotel for a wonderful stay in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: Harpmj
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in Madrid with our two children aged 9 and 7, using this hotel in the centre of the city as our base. While there were one or two things we would have like to have had available to us, we can have no argument over the price of the room for a week in high season. Madrid was very hot at the end of July and packed with tourists, so the return each afternoon to a airconditioned room with fresh linen, a large TV and interesting modern furniture was greatly appreciated. The maid service too was excellent - we were often late up and out, and they were quite patient in waiting for us to leave before cleaning our room. I could have wished for a lock on the bathroom door (something the hotel can fix), and that our room had a balcony on which we could sit and watch the world go by once the children had gone to bed (less easily fixable) and also perhaps that the breakfasts had been priced slightly lower which might have enticed my family to indulge (rather than survive on cereal bars). Oh, and the mini-bar could have been colder. For these points, the hotel gets 4 out of 5. There are simply some things that cannot be changed about Madrid which one simply has to accept e.g. - the high prices of beer - the insistence of all restaurants to rip you off through charging for covers (reduce your end-of-meal tip if you do not agree with this practice) - the inability of 95% of any restaurant serving pizza (my kids don't do Spanish food!) to serve you anything other than a sloppy cheese-fest (the one exception being on the south eastern corner of Plaza Mayor which did a lovely plate of pasta for about 8 Euros. - the beggars - the heinous price of the theme park near the zoo. The zoo is fairly heinously priced as well but it is a very enjoyable afternoon's entertainment. But on the whole, very reasonable value in a high-priced city. Thank you for a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pauline B
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights last week in July with 2 older children so had two rooms. Both were really. Modern and clean. Staff helpful and happy. Bar was the best along road and good prices. We live in Spain and will definately return here and recommend to friends. Air con was nice and cool as very hot few days. Car parking close by.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but small room”
Reviews.Author: Kiwilah
Reviews.Content: We were generally impressed with this hotel - it is conveniently located and easy to get to and in easy reach of several Metro stations. The hotel is clean and well maintained and the staff are very helpful in general. However there were a couple of negatives: - The room was not ready when we arrived, which was just after the advertised check in time. We were not put off by the duty managers attempt at a rebuff but to their credit we eventually got an apology and a free drink after some remonstration. - We asked for a family room and this consisted of a queen bed and a pull down double. This was too small for our teenage son and also with the bed down, there was not much room to move around. Not really a proper family sized room. - The bar stopped serving drinks at 10:30. Bearing in mind most locals are just setting out for dinner at that time, we found this surprising. We would probably stay here again but in a different room configuration.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Old Madrid”
Reviews.Author: KnitMs
Reviews.Content: Posada del Leon de Oro is a real gem and much better than the 4 star rating the Spanish hotel ratings give it. We were greated by Nacho, who let us choose our room from 2 that were available. The rooms are very modern, in contrast with the exterior and common rooms of the hotel which date way back. Our room was in the back of the hotel so we were not disturbed by the street noises. The Calle Cava Baja is known for its many tapas bars and restaurants and in true Spanish style, they are open and partying until the wee hours of the morning. The location is very convenient to the Plaza Mayor and other tourist areas, including the Royal Palace. If you don't want to walk around, you can get the red bus at the Plaza. The restaurant in the hotel was excellent and the service very attentive. A unique feature of the restaurant and the small bar at the front of the lobby was the glass floor which allows you to see the archeologic structures found during renovation and excavation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom2rk
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 5 nights in July. I did so much research on hotels in Madrid before going - this was a perfect fit for our family. We got 2 Cava rooms for the 4 of us and this gave us a lot of space. The rooms were connected by one main outside door. The hotel is very modern, new and contemporary. The king beds were super comfy and the rain showers were awesome. The best part of this hotel is its location. It is right on Cava Baja with some of the best restaurants in Madrid with 1 - 5 mins walking distance. We didn't have to go far for great food and that was absolutely the best. The hotel is 2 mins walk to Plaza Mayor and 7 mins to Puerto del Sol. Location was superb if you are a foodie. The hotel is in the older part of Madrid with lots of charm. It has a very different feel than the chain hotels near the Prada/Retiro park. Our family preferred the more intimide setting of this location and felt we were really experiencing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Party central, fun! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Camille H
Reviews.Content: Arriving late was no problem at this lively hotel. Our two teens were thrilled to see our taxi stop in the middle of a friendly, narrow street lined with tapas bars, restaurants and gelato stands, each brimming with lots of families as well as many young adults and teens. The hotel's street doors were wide open at ground level, welcoming guests into their popular bar and restaurant area. We were given a clean, third floor room with two queen beds. Surprisingly, it was actually quiet despite the party down below (even on the night of the European Soccer cup!) Much needed, on the premises laundry service was available for about 15 Euros for a small load. Our only problem during our stay was the shower's slow drainage; the two inch stall rim flooded over during one of my daughter's showers. We forgot to mention this problem to the staff on our early AM checkout -- I hope it gets repaired soon. We loved our stay otherwise; the staff was very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family with older kids”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, staff was nice & helpful! Sounds from the bar/restaurant might be difficult for young family trying to sleep early, but if you do as the locals & stay up later for dinner/socializing, you'll sleep just fine. The location was close to Plaza Mayor & lots of food/shops/metro. A/C worked great in the room (it was really hot during our visit to Spain).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, but lively”
Reviews.Author: Fubarski
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean with a modern contemporary feel and tastefully renovated. Friendly staff, great breakfast buffet with hot options (well worth booking on check in) as you can get it a couple of euros cheaper at check in. Nice spacious rooms, only draw back for me personally was the noise from the street. We were given a nice family room on the second floor at the front of the hotel (room 204) as there were three of us staying. It had a small balcony too which was nice. However, the bar next door to the hotel stays open very late indeed. The people I was with had no trouble sleeping but I have to say I was glad I took my ear buds as the party goes on well into the early morning. Fri and Sat very early. Luckily the beds are the best I have ever slept in of any hotel I have stayed in. No complaints as if I couldn't sleep I would have asked to be moved. Just beware of the noise if your in a room at the front. Don't let this put you off though as the hotel is very nice and the area is buzzin so you have to expect some noise.

Reviews.Title: “This place is unbelievable. I feel so lucky to have discovered it”
Reviews.Author: BudgiesLondon
Reviews.Content: Being very fussy, and never satisfied with the huge business hotels I try and find something special. Something intimate, modern, light, can give me a flavour of my host city, fabulous so I can brag about it etc etc. And to be honest, it's a tough ask and I'm often disappointed. Not so here. This was all these things and more. I had to leave Madrid a night early and the staff were so fantastic, generous and accommodating. They responded to my every whim. Thank you for a beautiful glimpse into your beautiful city. Ps I don't know how they do it for that price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent dinner”
Reviews.Author: roamers1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an excellent dinner here. It has recently been upgraded in a major way and is beautifully presented. The food and service were also great. It is in an ideal location in Cava Baja. Will explore the rooms next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb bijou hotel in centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel that has been extensively refurbished and offer modern large rooms with every facility. We paid only 70 UKP for large double bedded room with balcony. Staff were extremely friendly especially Nacho who even took me to the car park. Five minutes walk from Plaza Mayor and in the Latina district which is full of bars and restaurants. This hotel, and the staff, were better than a number of Paradores we stayed in for a lot more money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Madrid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hapsmear
Reviews.Content: Located within a few blocks of Plaza Mayor and the center of old Madrid, this hotel is a gem. It is on Cava Baja which is known for its tapas bars and horno restaurants. The staff of the hotel are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are sparkling clean and very modern. The beds are extremely comfortable. The restaurant in the hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small, modern”
Reviews.Author: AnnaChiChi
Reviews.Content: Area was just amazing - oldest part of the city, hotel situated in the narrow street, bit noisy, great restaurants nearby (unfortunately they were all closed before the midnight, except bars where only beer and jamon were served), few minutes to the city centre, 7 min walking to the metro station, 6 min to the big market ( cheese and jamon we did buy in there were great and fresh). We reserved this hotel in hurry, so didn't check the exact living space and it was like the last one room available. Bah…was such a small one.Sure, was all my fault, had to double check it. If you suffer from claustrophobia it’s definitely not for you. There was no mirror and sink in the bathroom, not any space for girly stuff; water was always leaking right in the room after every shower. It was a sink in the room next to the bed though, quite interesting and unique, but made me feel uncomfortable. There was the only window opened on the inner covered court, so only conditioner could help as it was not any fresh air in there. Ah and they didn’t change any towel during all the 3 days we stayed in the hotel. Anyway the trip was nice; hotel was modern, cute and cosy. Stuff was quite friendly. Every evening local and foreign people were gathering in the hall and restaurant downstairs, so we made several acquaintances of other tourists, liked the atmosphere of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: lynne m
Reviews.Content: I visited Madrid with friends and we stayed in this hotel. It is in a superb location for exploring the city with lots of tapas bars etc on your doorstep or you can eat and drink in the hotel too which is also lovely and very stylish. The staff are very friendly and welcoming and the rooms are modern and very clean. I would love to stay there again and would recommend it to anyone! It was just perfect...

Reviews.Title: “Old World Meets Modern”
Reviews.Author: abbyjiang
Reviews.Content: A perfect location and lovely place. We stayed with our daughter for 3 nights. The hotel is located at the old city in the middle of everything, in a charming late 19th century building, renovated. Room has a beautiful new bathroom, stunning stylish modern lamps, chairs and a Murphy bed pulled from wall. There are bar and restaurant at the first floor, but our room facing courtyard was quite.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: HaveCoffeeWillTravel
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adored staying at the Posada. The staff was amazingly warm and welcoming, the food, drinks, and service were superb. The location was ideal. Centrally located, my boyfriend and I walk all over the city. To the Posado, to the castle, to various shopping and restaurants. It seems to be in a more upper scale area and we always felt safe walking around, even after midnight coming back from a late dinner. We will definitely stay here again, if we ever make it back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent price:quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: MAWander
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the same hotel between Sol and the Prado the six or seven times I've come to Madrid, but chose this place after reading a positive review in the New York Times. Stayed here for only two nights and am glad to have done so. I liked this small hotel quite a bit. The location on Calle Cava Baja in La Latina feels more 'neighborhood-y' in the sense that, at night time, people come to enjoy the many tapas bars and restaurants along the street. In the morning and during the day, the area was quite peaceful even though it's only a stone's throw from the Plaza Mayor and Sol. My room (not the smallest, nor the largest of the three types available) was quite large and looked over the Calle Cava Baja. I was concerned about the potential for noise, but the sound insulation provided by the double-glazed windows was excellent and I slept exceptionally well. Nice things about the room included clean lines, a huge flat-screen TV, memory-foam mattress, two kinds of pillows, modern tub/shower/toilet/sink, nice tubes of bath products, lots of lighting options, abundant plugs, a large safe, and this sort of clothes-hanger thing that was separate from the hangers in the closet. Clearly a lot of thought went into the design of the rooms. I ate at the little tapas bar in the lobby and thought the food was of a high quality. Particularly enjoyed the tosta with jamon iberico and salmorejo as well as the croquetas with spinach, bacalao, pine nuts and raisins. The sangria was really nice, too. The only small drawback, and I suppose an inevidible effect of a room that's almost entirely white, is that small scuffs show up easily on the floors and walls. Nothing major, but noticeable here and there. Similarly, in an all-white bathroom, spots on the grout and dirt on the caulking show up easily. I imagine that, in time, the hotel will need to do a thorough 'once-over' to restore the rooms' original shine. I'd add that the price certainly was right... I booked many weeks in advance and took the risk that my plans wouldn't change. Paid 100 euros a night and consider that pretty much a bargain for the location and quality of the room. Had I needed to cancel, however, there would have been no refund. Glad it worked out. I would stay at the Posada del Leon de Oro again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan F
Reviews.Content: When booking our hotel I actually meant to book the property next door (Dragon) but it turned out to be a very happy mistake (thank you Google!)! The desk staff at the Posada del Leon were very helpful and spoke excellent English. After our three-night stay we had to catch a very early morning train and they arranging a taxi and early check-out was no problem at all. Our room was spacious with an incredibly comfortable and huge bed (memory foam mattress) and it also had a walk-in shower/wet room. It overlooked the narrow bustling street below but because of the sound-proofing we had no problem with the noise. The only slight problem we had with the room was that the air-conditioning left both of us with sore throats every morning, but this wore off in the afternoons. Despite this, I would highly recommend the hotel. One of the best things about this hotel is its location. La Latina and the Cava Baja itself is a great area for bars and restaurants and is still within walking distance of the city centre squares. The hotel was very goodvalue for money and was a great place to start our Spanish holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 1travel4fun23
Reviews.Content: A beautiful historic building in a great central location between the Rastro and the Plaza Mayor in Madrid, rooms and public areas are tastefully renovated without spoiling the old feel of the place. The staff is friendly and helpful, the coffee great, the wine selection impressive. The rooms are spacious with excellent beds and great showers. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MaJaFinland
Reviews.Content: We can easily recommend this lovely hotel. Service was friendly and helpful, and the location of the hotel is excellent; La Latina is nice and lively area and the metro station is near. Our room was chic and spacious (even I read in advance that the rooms are small..?). Also Wi-fi worked, which was nice. The only minus is that the advertised "Breakfast buffet for 12 euros" is not really a buffet, but You can order coffee, bread, eggs etc. from a menu.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for good food, great atmosphere and the hustle and bustle of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Monica822
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 3 nights in Madrid staying at the lovely Posada Del Leon y Oro. Situated on the lively Cava Baja, it’s in a great location for exploring the city and enjoying the hustle and bustle and yummy food and wine Madrid has to offer. The beautiful old Spanish building has been restored to a very high standard mixing tradition and modern perfectly - its very stylish yet affordable and comfortable and not at all pretentious. The hotel reception area has a great atmosphere with its bustling tapas / pinchos bar to the front, and restaurant to the back. After a day out it was a fun place to come back to and enjoy a glass of wine and a pincho before retiring to the room. We stayed in room 205 which was in the cheapest price category. It was a decent size with a small balcony overlooking the lively Cava Baja, great for people watching and feeling part of Madrid life (I'm not sure if all the rooms have a balcony so I'd recommend ours). The bathroom is small but stylish, and the shower is amazing! The sink is in the bedroom, not the bathroom, but it is sectioned off. The bed was very comfortable with great pillows. You do hear a tiny bit of noise from the bar downstairs and the busy street below, but nothing that we found annoying, just a gentle hum of Madrid life happening below us. Very few cars come down the road, it might as well be a pedestrianised road full of Madrileños deciding where to eat and drink. We would definitely stay there again. The location is great, really central and you can walk to most places. Plus you are in the heart of the restaurant area so if you love Spanish food and wine, you'll be in heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bar review only (not a hotel guest)”
Reviews.Author: mctang
Reviews.Content: This review refers only to the hotel bar, as my friends and I were not guests at the hotel. That said, the hotel bar was fantastic. We stopped in for some drinks before dinner one night and decided to partake of some of their delicious-looking tapas. Neither the drinks nor the tapas disappointed. This place was such a pleasant experience that when we were in the neighborhood again a couple of nights later, we stopped in one more time, this time to wash away the terrible dinner experience we had suffered through at a previous establishment. If you're in the neighborhood, definitely worth a drop-in.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_PThailand
Reviews.Content: I first contacted the hotel a month ago about availability and rates and had received a reply about the rates the next day. It was a very good rate and I immediately wrote back that I wanted to book and asked them if I could reserve specific room I saw on the website. I didn't hear from the hotel and I wrote back again after a few days and still didn't hear from them. I contacted my friend who lives in Madrid to try to call the hotel for me and it took the hotel several days to send me an email giving new rates. I wrote back questioning since the rate that the hotel has given me the second time is much higher like 50 euro per night. The reply I got back from the hotel was that if I had booked then, I would have been given the cheap rate but because its been 3 weeks now, the hotel is almost full, so the rate is higher. I wrote back that this is not my fault since i had tried to contact the hotel many times and they never replied. I never heard from the hotel again. And I know that they have received my email! I am still looking for hotel in Madrid and I certainly don't recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Randy808
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience! The room was the smallest I have ever been in necessitating in an under-sized bed that my feet hung-off and I am not tall. The bathroom so small that the sink is in the room next to the bed. You also have to close the curtain making it even more of a cave because people were watching us in bed from just 10 ft away. The wifi is so slow they give you the password for the neighboring hotel to use. In the restaurant they can’t even cook a steak right and it came cut-up like I was a child. Cava Baja claims to have many Tapa bars which is untrue they are just bars period! Stay away, Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Wine, food and hedonism (even if the rooms are a little small...)”
Reviews.Author: Travellerisrael
Reviews.Content: This is more of an inn than a hotel – a restaurant/bar with several guests room built around a central patio. Location: in the middle of the Madrid bohemia. If good food, wine and general hedonism are your thing – this is the place for you. The street in which this inn is located (Calle cava baja) and the entire area are filled to the brim with restaurants, bars, tapas places and what not. Every night and especially during the weekends the area looks like a huge party is going on. It's walking distance to plaza mayor and plaza puerta de sol (5 minutes) and also to the opera house, palace and gran via (10-15 minutes). There is also a close by metro station. You can get here from the airport using the metro, it costs something like 3 Euros but you do need to change the line twice and it takes about 40 minutes. Taxi on a Sunday morning cost us 46 Euros. The rooms: the place is new and recently renovated so everything looks new and nice. Our room however was tiny. The queen bed took up most of it. This is a problem if you need some space or if you intend to work in the room (it's basically impossible). Despite the party going on every night when you close the window you can hardly here the sounds (our room faced the patio; I don't know what happens in the rooms facing the street). There is supposedly a free WI-FI. It had not worked even once during our 3 days stay, we asked them to take care of it twice but somehow they were not able to so we just gave up. The food: this is a restaurant/bar after all. You can have very cheap great coffee in the little bar down stairs and also good food (definitely not continental rather hard core Spanish). You can also have an excellent dinner during the evenings at the restaurant (beware the place is packed every night, especially during weekends so if you intend to eat there let them know in advance). Being a "Taberna" they have a mind boggling array of wines and alcoholic beverages. The staff were always nice, mostly efficient (except for the WI-FI part), and even made sure we knew the clock was about to change so we won't have unexpected surprises during the morning. we arrived early so they talked to the maid to preapare our room so we won't have to wait too long. We speak Spanish but I saw them speaking in fluent English with other guests so that also shouldn't be a problem. All in all: if you are looking to stay in the middle of the Madrid hedonistic charm in a lively, simpatic hotel this is it. The two major cons were the size and the WI-FI not working. This is not a good place for a business stay but excellent for a romantic getaway or just plain having fun.

Reviews.Title: “It is called a 'singular' hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ColinY
Reviews.Content: The staff are the most welcoming and helpful, the rooms are well designed and beautifully kept, the location is unusual but ideal for a weekend of sightseeing and, Yes, I'd really like to keep it to myself - singular ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some design issues”
Reviews.Author: Charles E
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for our trip to Spain (3 nights each in Madrid, Seville and Barcelona). Overall the hotel is aesthetically pleasing from the moment you enter, renovated and new, spacious lobby, and very chic. It is usually bustling with traffic, especially in the evenings, as this particular area of Madrid is known for Tapas. The rooms were very modern, yet small with some design flaws. Overall I would rate it a 4 as the location and updated aspects of the hotel outweighed the design and spacial setbacks. Positive Aspects of the Hotel: - Modern and updated, both lobby and rooms - Location is great, within short walking distance to areas of interest - Cleanliness was never an issue - Friendly staff, willing to help with whatever is needed (directions, access to services, etc.) - Secured by locked front door late at night, with attendant at desk 24 hours Negative Aspects of the Hotel: - Rooms are small, with sink in the bedroom about 2-3 feet from the bed - Bathroom is small, with little room to maneuver - Shower and sink do not drain well, shower could potentially overrun into floor if you are not careful - Can be a touch noisy at times with the bustling traffic downstairs

Reviews.Title: “a modern hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Cheeky_Porky
Reviews.Content: The location is very good as it is near to mercado de san miguel, the square, sol and most of all it is located in the heart of the cava baja where tapas bar are everywhere. the surrounding area have very good restaurants too. The hotel is very modern. Well renovated. We stayed in a suite located on 3rd floor so we did not have much problem about the noise at night. If you can spare extra Euro, booked the suite (304). Liked the black and white décor. Loved the whirlpool tub! The bed is comfy. Nice rain head shower. Good toiletries and towels. Bathrobe provided. The hotel lobby bar is very good. The best sangria!!! Very good finger foods too. I’m only giving this hotel 4* rating because 1st – there is no room service. No information about the hotel in the room. most of all coz they did not clean our room on our 2nd day. When we came back to our room (around 6pm), it was undone. I called the reception and they asked me if we hanged the “do not disturbed sign”. NO we did not! So he asked when they can come and cleaned. Informed him around 9pm as we are heading out for dinner. When we came back, the only thing they did were replace the mini bar and lousily made the bed. The old towels were left in the tub, the toilet has not been cleaned as well as the basin and trash can. Disappointing Will I recomend this hotel? YES. Hoping their house keeping will improve.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donstallione
Reviews.Content: Very tastefully refurbished colonial building right in Calle Cava Baja which is absolutely buzzing in the evening, The hotel itself is beautiful, staff are friendly enough, if a little disorganized, we asked where we could find a launderette nearby to wash some babies clothes and the hotel kindly offered to wash them themselves, however the guy we left them with never passed on the message and the clothes never got washed, just a minor complaint but still caused an inconvenience none the less. The restaurant serves very good food and the whole lobby/bar/restaurant area has a great atmosphere in the evenings, just make sure they don't charge you for things that you haven't ordered. We managed to get a special rate on booking.com and it was well worth it, our room was absolutely beautiful and huge, I'm not sure if I would have been so content had we paid the full rate as it is similar to that of some 5 star hotels in Madrid but for what we paid, it was a great deal. Location is great, 10 minutes walk from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor, 5 minutes walk to either Tirso de Molina or La Latina Metro, and is surrounded by Restaurants. Very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: farbman
Reviews.Content: We spent one overnight in the Posada del leon de oro with our two children (10 and 13). The receptionists spoke English (which is not trivial in Spain), and were nice and helpful. The room was clean, nicely decorated, spacy for a hotel in the very center of Madrid, and the beds were exceptionally comfortable. The location is a few minutes walking from the plaza mayor, and a little more walking from the royal palace and the Prado museum. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel! Art Deco Loved it. Wish there was a pool in Madrid Heat”
Reviews.Author: ApurvGarg
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay, room was good small cafe in the restaurant was nice many places to have breakfast outside the hotel Kids would have loved it more if there was a small pool to chill and relax from 40 degrees summer heat We had to change rooms as the bathroom door was broken which was made out of glass and wasted a lot fo time due to this Am sure you can find better hotels at Playa Mayore or other locations with more facilities at same price. Worth a visit though

Reviews.Title: “Not familiar with the hotel but the restaurant is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CriteriousTourist
Reviews.Content: We werent guest in the hotel but we were walking around in the La Latina neighborhood and we find this jam there. It is restaurant is very charming with its glass floor. The food was great, the wine was fantastic and the service out of this world. The best service in Madrid and one of the best in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliaScott
Reviews.Content: this hotel is def one of the best I stayed at. decoration and design is very interesting. I could tell its farely new. Location is def great. Staff was friendly. The only thing is the restaurant on site is a bit pricey, but where in europe it isnt! Overall i liked it, would def reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find!”
Reviews.Author: Arturas
Reviews.Content: Stay two nights in this pretty new hotel. As someone mentioned before the hotel is in a nice location for someone who likes food and spend time having drinks. Lots of restaurants and bars in the neighboorhood! Metro station is just around the corner. Found service friendly which is rare in Madrid. We had room with balcony facing the street and when we arrived late at night It was very busy so my first thought was: there is no way I can sleep with that street noice. To my big surprise, inside of the room I hardly could hear street noice, good isolated room and I had perfect sleep both nights. I must admit you can hear some noice from the restaurant inside the courtyard but it did not bother me at all as they close quite early compared to Madrid standard. Room was big, nice decorated and with comfortable bed. The bathroom was good size too, semi open, with great rain shower and nice cosmetic products. What I liked is that there is possibility to have breakfast not only in restaurant but as well in their bar/cafe next to reception. They serve coffe, delicious fresh croissants, spanish toast for a very reasonable price. So, for someone who do not want have full breakfast but start the day with a good strong coffee and a croissant is a nice option. I hope they keep the service and the room quality the way it was during our stay, definately a place to return.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Madrid !”
Reviews.Author: martintrent
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the afternoon and received a very warm welcome, including a drink and tapas. The staff is friendly, helpfull and english speaking. Try the restaurant at night, and the breakfast is very tasty and cheap. The location is super right in the heart of the latina district. We will certainly come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PeterWorthNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with my wife on our way to Mallorca. The hotel was pretty cool and modern. Wasn´t a huge fan of the decoration but everything else was very nice. The one thing that really stands out about this hotel is the location. It is right in the heart of the Latina area in Madrid. Right next to great tapas bars, restaurants and cool bars. I think for the price and location you can´t go wrong. Overall, we would recommend this place to others.
